main event: Multiple sightings of a bright, bluish-white light in Clarksville, Iowa, on different dates in 1957 and 1958.
interesting points: The object moved erratically through the sky, as reported by a radar operator and observed by others.
The object was reported to be stationary at first and then suddenly split into two objects.
It was described as a round object that disappeared behind clouds with a lighted, fluttering appearance.
The estimated speed of the object was approximately 600 MPH, and it was slightly larger than a star.
The document indicates that further preliminary analysis as to the cause of the sighting was requested.
sighted object: bright, bluish-white light or round object
witnesses: radar operator, pilot, and other observers
